alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Fluvanna (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 07 at 7:14PM EDT until July 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Cumberland County in central Virginia... Southeastern Fluvanna County in central Virginia... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 714 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lakeside Village, or near Fork Union, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Fork Union, Cartersville, Columbia, Lakeside Village, Duncan, Dixie, Trents Mill, Ashby, Oak Forest, Shores, Bremo Bluff, Clinton, Cohasset, Whiteville, Grays Siding, Bear Creek Lake State Park and Trenton Mills. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
